New Records: Freddy Peralta pitched six scoreless innings, allowing two walks and two hits, and struck out eight.
William Contreras hit a two-run home run in the fifth inning, his 18th of the season.
Key Match Events: The Brewers built a 5-0 lead with a five-run fifth inning, led by Contreras' home run and an RBI base single by Jackson Chourio.
The Giants spoiled the shutout bid with a run in the seventh and two more in the eighth.
Pre-Game Insights: There were no pre-game insights mentioned in the article.
Post-Match Reflections: Brewers manager Pat Murphy praised Freddy Peralta's performance, saying 'Freddy was fantastic.'
Giants manager Bob Melvin said 'We weren't great offensively except for that one little stretch.'
Contreras echoed those sentiments, saying 'I like his execution.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Brewers moved to within 1 1/2 games of the Philadelphia Phillies for the second seed in the NL playoffs and two games behind the Los Angeles Dodgers for the top spot.
The Giants spoiled the shutout bid with a run in the seventh and two more in the eighth.
Others: Devin Williams bounced back from his first blown save last Wednesday at St. Louis with a 1-2-3 ninth for his sixth save in seven chances.
The Giants came in having won seven of the last 10 games at American Family Field and nine of the last 14 overall dating to 2019.
